meta.name: description
meta.content: Laverne Public Schools is located in Laverne, OK within Harper County in NW Oklahoma. Our mission is to provide all students the opportunity to acquire requisite academic, social, and life skills necessary for the 21st Century.

div.class: custom_26071 img-responsive no-border col-md-12 wow animated wow animated zoomIn

p.b: HONORING THE LAVERNE HIGH SCHOOL GRADUATING CLASS OF 2020

div.p: Â Â The Laverne Class of 2020 will graduate on Friday, May 22nd at 7:00 pm.Â We will be honoring them with a graduation parade.Â The parade will start at 7:00 pm and will follow the Laverne Tiger homecoming parade route, beginning at the park, proceeding east, and eventually heading back west down Jane Jayroe Boulevard.Â Each graduate will be followed by immediate family in cars. We ask that the community park somewhere on the parade route in order to honor all graduates. You are welcome to put signs in your yards, hold signs, put out Tiger flags, etc. to help make this a special time for our graduates.Â Â A graduation stage will be set up at the south end of Kilmer field. Each graduate will enter the stage, be recognized, turn tassel, and proceed to a spot on Kilmer field. The family of each graduate will be allowed to park in front of the stage, outside the fence to take pictures while their graduate is on stage.Â EVERYONE ONE ELSE SHOULD REMAIN IN THEIR CAR AT ALL TIMES. NO ONE WILL BE ALLOWED TO ENTER TRACK AND/OR THE STADIUM AT ANYTIME. We will honor graduates with the playing of the tiger fight song at the conclusion of the ceremony.
Â Â E-Lan broadcasting will broadcast the ceremony on www.citylinktv.com/channel/laverne so that those in cars around the route and those unable to attend can hear and watch the ceremony.Â Â

Â Â This is a very special time for these individuals who have worked hard to reach this important milestone in their lives.Â While the traditional LHS graduation ceremony is not an option at this time, we are excited to be able to honor the Class of 2020 in a very special way by practicing social distancing and being mindful of the safety of our community and families.Â Please join us in honoring these very deserving young people on May 22, 2020 at 7:00 pm from your car.
